about.textOne: I'm Mía Salazar, a galactic Front-End developer who has been navigating the galaxy doing good code since 2018, terrestrial calendar.
about.textTwo: As a spacecraft pilot for the Galatic Programmers Alliance, I enjoy learning about the languages ​​that exist in the universe, discovering better ways to solve problems, working as a team with the other crew members of the spacecraft, and being in constant learning.

skills.textOne: Besides, as part of this alliance, I have a number of skills and knowledge in languages.
skills.textTwo: In the Galactic Alliance of Programmers, we value creating scalable architectures, clean, maintainable and reusable code, active listening to new ways of programming and constant improvement.
skills.html: HTML5, CSS3, SCSS, SASS, Responsive Web Design
skills.css: Bootstrap 4, Materialize, Bulma, Angular Material, Tailwind...

portfolio.oldText: Before I became a Galactic Front-end and joined the Galatian Programmers Alliance, I used to watch out for good code on Planet Earth as a superhero. If you are curious to know that past, take a look at my old portfolio.
portfolio.subtitle: In this panel you can see the missions in which I have participated within the Galactic Alliance of Programmers. Some missions happened in React's star cluster, others in Angular, and some less in Vue's. Within each mission, I have used different languages ​​and skills.

awards.textOne: Throughout my career with the Alliance, I have received written reports on the different missions that I have carried out and have participated in various terrestrial projects with other members of the Alliance.
awards.scientificText: Here you can see the scientific articles that I wrote during my pre-galactic stage.
awards.articlesText: Here you can see the different reports that I have written, about both programming and cybersecurity.
awards.othersText: Here you can see the interviews that have been carried out with me and other projects in which I have participated in Earth
